moves.4... Nf6: Most popular answer. Also Bc5 is playable!
moves.5. e5 d5 6. Bb5 Nd7: Normal move in this position is Ne4, but to escape the theory books Nd7 is a good alternative
moves.7. O-O Bc5: In my opinion Be7, would lead to a equal game, but with Bc5 the game is different, and I think white has more chances
moves.8. Bxc6 bxc6 9. Bg5 Be7 10. Nxd4 Nb8: In this position a move like Bb7 would be the move that I would choose. Here's a possible continuation: 10. Nd4 Bb7 11.Bxe7 Qxe7 12.Nf5 Dg5 13.Dh5 Dxh5. Black has no big issues at all.
moves.11. Bxe7 Qxe7 12. Nc3: Now black has lost a tempo with the knight, and white has an opportunity to gain some space advantage
moves.12... Ba6: I think this move is an error! Will lead to a forced move: Re1. That is a dangerous move! A move like 12... a5, or 12... 0-0, would be preferable in my opinion.
moves.13. Re1 Qh4: Don't know what's the plan of this move, but it increases the king's unsafety!
moves.14. e6 O-O 15. exf7+:
Black is getting hoppeless. Maybe the best chance now was to play 15... Rh8. Here's a possible continuation: 16.Re8 Nd7 17. Qe1 Rc8 De7 Qxd4 Qxd7.
Nevertheless, White has big advantage!
moves.16. Nxd5: Here I thought in the move Ne6, but with some luck I found this move! Never thought it was so powerfull!
moves.16... cxd5 17. Nf5: Forcing the black's queen to move, and opening spaces for mine!
moves.17... Qc4 18. Qh5+ Kf6 19. Ne7 g6: g6, will lead to a mate in six moves I think! Later on I'll put the puzzle on gk! Here you have the solution too :p
